usage.thanks:
Use this to award and track goodwill within your server
`{{prefix}}thx @someone` - Send 'Thanks' to someone.
`{{prefix}}thx top` - Check leaderboards.

**Moderation Only**
`{{prefix}}thx clear [USER_ID]` - Wipe someone's THX points.

*To ensure these points are always organic, they cannot be manually awarded. Only wiped.*
usage.pin:
`{{prefix}}pin` - Pins the last message posted to the channel
`{{prefix}}pin [Message ID]` Pins a specific message, regardless of its channel.
usage.reminder:
`{{prefix}}reminder (list|delete) [Reminder Text and Time (| Time) ] (-c #channel)`

The most basic usage is: `{{prefix}}reminder do this in 3 hours`, `{{prefix}}reminder do this next tuesday 2pm`, `{{prefix}}reminder do this tomorrow 14:34 PST`
The default reminder channel is via DMs, if you want to specify a channel try: `{{prefix}}reminder do this 14:20 -c #channel`

In some cases the wording can be confusing, so to completely isolate the timer from the text you can use `|`:
`{{prefix}}reminder watch 007: Tomorrow never dies | next friday` Here the word 'tomorrow' could confuse things a bit, so using `|` ensures only what is past it will be accounted as time.

To list your current reminders:
`{{prefix}}reminder list`
To remove reminders:
`{{prefix}}reminder delete (index)` Removes the reminder at the `index` position. Removes the last one if none is specified.
usage.ytalert:
`{{prefix}}ytalert [add|remove|list] [Channel URL | Channel ID] (#channel)`

`{{prefix}}rss add [URL] #channel` Starts posting new videos from that YouTube channel at #channel or at the channel the command was used if no channel was tagged.
`{{prefix}}ytalert remove 1` `{{prefix}}ytalert remove [URL]` Removes the YouTube Channel from position 1 (see `list`) or with the specified URL.
`{{prefix}}ytalert list` Lists all currently active YouTube alerts.

>**New videos update every 1 hour*
usage.rss:
`{{prefix}}rss [add|remove|list] [RSS URL] (#channel)`

`{{prefix}}rss add [URL] #channel` Starts posting from that Feed at #channel or at the channel the command was used if no channel was tagged.
`{{prefix}}rss remove 1` `{{prefix}}rss remove [URL]` Removes the RSS feed from position 1 (see `list`) or with the specified URL.
`{{prefix}}rss list` Lists all currently active RSS feeds.

>**Feeds update every 15 minutes*
usage.personaltext:
`{{prefix}}ptxt [Your text here]`
This is displayed in your Profile Card
usage.tagline:
`{{prefix}}tagline [Your text here]`
This is displayed in your Profile Card
usage.fragment:
`{{prefix}}fragment [bg | medal | sticker] [last | ITEM_ID ]`
 `last` Breaks the last Cosmetic of that type you've obtained, and gives you **Cosmo Shards** acording to its rarity tier.
`ITEM ID` Using the item ID points directly to a specific cosmetic in your inventory.

usage.didyoumean:
`{{prefix}}dym [Any Text | ([Message ID | ^ ] [Any Text]) ]`
Any text following `dym` will be used for your 'Did you mean...?' response.

`{{prefix}}dym [MESSAGE ID] [Text here]` If you want to target a specific message to quote
`{{prefix}}dym [Your text here] ^` to quote the message immediately above. the `^` can be anywhere in the text. Note that all occurences of `^` will be erased.
usage.safebooru:
`{{prefix}}safebooru [tags]`
For spacing use  `_` :*`{{prefix}}safe blue_hair`*
For multiple tags use `+` :*`{{prefix}}safe blue_hair+pointy_ears`*
To ignore certain tags, use `-` before them: *`{{prefix}}safe blue_hair+pointy_ears+-1girl`*

$t(commands:addends.booru)
usage.localnews:
`{{prefix}}localnews [Text Headline] (Image Link | @someone)` Will take every text on it and try the following:
 -Find an image link, if an invalid link is provided, it will be blank
 -If there is no link, it will check for mentions, and use their profile picture
 -If that also fails, it will try to find the last image posted in the channel or an image posted alongside the message
 -If everything fails, it will use your own profile picture

*If no headline whatsoever is provided, it will show a random actual headline from CNN*
usage.transfer:
**Requires crafting a [Transfer License]({{websiteRoot}}/grimoire/transferlicense)!**

`{{prefix}}transfer [Amount] [@user]` Will transfer Rubines to @User. 4hs Cooldown

`{{prefix}}transfer box [Rarity (optional)] [@user]` Will transfer a Lootbox to @User. 2hs Cooldown

$t(commands:meta.referCrafting)
usage.reactionroles:
`{{prefix}}reactionroles [add|del|list|clear] [#channel] [Message ID] [EMOJI] [Role Name | @Role]`
Quite an extensive command huh? Let's break it down:

To add a new Reaction for a Role to a message:
`{{prefix}}reactionroles add #channel MESSAGE_ID :emoji: My Awesome Role`

To remove one or all Reaction bindings from a Message:
`{{prefix}}reactionroles del MESSAGE_ID :emoji:` For one emoji/role pair only.
`{{prefix}}reactionroles del MESSAGE_ID` For all emojis from that Message

You can see all Message/Role/Reaction bindings with `{{prefix}}reactionroles list`

You can nuke the entire thing with `{{prefix}}reactionroles clear`

Requires the user to have either `MANAGE SERVER` or `MANAGE ROLES` permissions, or a Pollux ModRole
usage.brackets:
`{{prefix}}brackets (-rr ) [number | list of entrants (comma-separated) | role <@role | Role Name> ]`

`{{prefix}}brackets 10` Generates Regular Brackets for 10 Teams (With pre-matches for Byes) (max.32)
`{{prefix}}brackets -rr role Tournament` Generates a Round-Robin Match Table for all members in the @Tournament role (max.16)
`{{prefix}}brackets team 1, team 2, team 3, team 4` Generates Regular Brackets for the listed teams (max.32)
usage.choose:
`{{prefix}}choose [Number (optional)] item1, item2, item3` for any arbitrary list.
`{{prefix}}choose [Number (optional)] [@role | Role Name]` for members within a Role.

When picking among more than 6 items, a list breakdown will be shown for dramatic purposes.
usage.rpgen:
`{{prefix}}rpgen [npc | (hook [player | npc ]) ]` - If no args are provided, `npc` will be used.
`rpgen NPC` Generates a random NPC with name, race, a few traits, and a color.
`rpgen HOOK [npc | player]` Will create a random happening to hook a story, adding `player` will include players into the hook.
usage.thx:
`{{prefix}}thx @someone` - Adds +1 *'Thanks'* to that person.
Thanks points are **local** and follow the same rules as the previous `{{prefix}}rep` (4 hours cooldown, no self-thanking), except they don't propagate globally.
Use this to quickly tell someone is helpful within the community without the need of great lengths like in `{{prefix}}commend`.
usage.commend:
`{{prefix}}commend [@user | info | stats @user]`
Commending requires you to have at least one **Commendation Token** to be spent. These can be obtained from Lootboxes or crafted.

`{{prefix}}commend @user` +1 Commend someone
`{{prefix}}commend info` Check your cooldown, you can commend people every 4 hours
`{{prefix}}commend stats @user` Check detailed information on a certain user's commendings.
$t(commands:meta.referCrafting)
usage.attribute:
`{{prefix}}attribute [set|del|list|ren] [tag name (one word only)] [value (any length you want)]`

 `add | set [name] [value]` - Creates a new tag/attribute. `value` can be anything from numbers to full annotations
 `dell | rem [name]` - Deletes a tag/attribute. Accepts `all` as an argument to wipe all items.
 `list`- Self explanatory
 `ren [current] [new]` - Renames a tag/attribute. Tags should be ONE-WORD only!

Add `!` before a tag name to tell it is a macro (used for `{{prefix}}roll`). Macros are used to script dice rolls and simple equations.
 ‚Ä¢ Macros accept other macros nested inside it except by itself. 25 iterations limit.
 ‚Ä¢ Macros accept non-macro attributes.
 ‚Ä¢ Result of macros cannot be used as # of dices. *(But **non**macro attributes can, remember to add a space after it)*
 ‚Ä¢ All attributes are case-sensitive.

Example of Macro Attributes:
**!Fireball** `6d8 + INT` | **!DarkEnergy** `4d12 + WIS` | **!HellFire** `(!Fireball - CON) / (!DarkEnergy * 2)`
You can create macros as complex as you wish, as long as they respect the rules above.

usage.logs:
`{{prefix}}logs #channel`
 Set all logs at the chosen Channel.

`{{prefix}}logs mod #channel`
 Set moderation logs (Bans, Kicks and Mutes) at the chosen Channel.

`{{prefix}}logs atv #channel`
 Set Activity logs (Members in and out, nickname edits) at the chosen Channel.

`{{prefix}}logs adv #channel`
 Set Advanced Logs (Deleted and edited messages, Channels created, Activation or Deactivation of modules) at the chosen Channel.

`{{prefix}}logs mod #channel delete`
Logs will no more be sent to this Channel

usage.bye:
`{{prefix}}bye [msg|timer] [mensagem|segundos]` 

`{{prefix}}bye msg Goodbye %user% !`
 Changes the message to "Goodbye @User !"

`{{prefix}}bye timer 10`
 Set a time in seconds for auto deletion, 0 for keep it forever.

`{{prefix}}bye`
Without any parameters, this command will toggle on and off the emittion of messages.

**Wildcards**:
`%user%` Mentions the user.
`%username%` Outputs the user's name, without mention.
usage.welcome:

 Changes the message to "Welcome @User !"

 Set a time in seconds for auto deletion, 0 for keep it forever.

`{{prefix}}welcome `
Without any parameters, this command will toggle on and off Welcome messages.

**Wildcards**:
`%user%` Mentions the user.
`%username%` Outputs the user's name, without mention.

usage.read&translate:
`{{prefix}}read&translate (From To | To) (Image Link)`

`(From | To)` Optional - 2 letter codes of the languages you want to translate from/to. (ISO 639-1 Code)
If only one language is supplied, it will be translated TO that language, and the FROM language will be autodetected.
If no languages are supplied, it will autodetect FROM and use the server language as TO.
`(Image Link)` Optional - A link to an image to be read from, attaching an image to the command message also works. If no image is supplied, one will be found from the channel history.

**See also:** `{{prefix}}translate` `{{prefix}}read`
usage.read:
`{{prefix}}read` Gets last image posted if available on cache
`{{prefix}} read [ url|image attachment ]` Reads text contained on an image attached or linked
usage.roll:
**Basic:**
`{{prefix}}roll [[Amount]<d(Faces)>] [extra operations]`
`{{prefix}}roll d20` | `{{prefix}}roll 5d6` | `{{prefix}}roll 150d12` | `{{prefix}}roll 10d4 + 8` | `{{prefix}}roll d12 - 10` | `{{prefix}}roll 60d7 / 7` | `{{prefix}}roll 1d100*5`

 Add thrill to your rolls by adding a delay (In seconds): `{{prefix}}roll 1d20 -t 5`

**Advanced:**
You can use special shorthands and *"macros"* to simplify complex rolls or include attributes like DEX/INT/STR or whatever you may want to call them. To configure these, please refer to the `{{prefix}}attribute` command.

 Example of Attribute usage:
 `{{prefix}}roll 1d20 + DEX` - if you have a DEX value saved
 `{{prefix}}roll !Fireball` - if you have a "Fireball" predefined roll macro *(e.g. 6d6 + INT)*. Every macro should have a `!` on its name, refer to `attribute` command for more info.
 `{{prefix}}roll DEX d6` - runs as many d6 as you have DEX.
usage.translate:
`{{prefix}}translate (From To | To) [Text | Message ID | ^]`

`(From | To)` Optional - 2 letter codes of the languages you want to translate from/to. (ISO 639-1 Code)
If only one language is supplied, it will be translated TO that language, and the FROM language will be autodetected.
If no languages are supplied, it will autodetect FROM and use the server language as TO.
`[Text | Message ID | ^]` Required - The text to be translated, a Message ID, or `^` to translate the previous message.

**See also:** `{{prefix}}read&translate`
usage.medal:
`{{prefix}}medal [medal_id]` or just `{{prefix}}medal`
 For example: `{{prefix}}medal darkmagirl` for the **Dark Magician Girl** medal.
usage.blackjack:
`{{prefix}}blackjack 150` | `{{prefix}}blackjack deck [id]`
 Minimum bet is 10, maximum is 2500.

**After the game starts:**
`stand` - Stops the game with the current hand
`hit` - Draws one more card
`double` - Draw one **last** card and double your bet
`split` (Advanced) - Available when you hold 2 cards of the same value: Split your hand and play two simmultaneous matches

**Decks**
You can customize your deck with `{{prefix}}blackjack deck [Skin ID]`
Check available decks with `{{prefix}}blackjack deck list` or `{{prefix}}decks`
*You can obtain more decks from the (User Marketplace)[{{websiteRoot}}/shop/marketplace] or from (Specialized Crafting)[{{websiteRoot}}/crafting#advanced]

**Jokers**
> **SOON‚Ñ¢Ô∏è**

`{{prefix}}exchange [Amount] [Destination Currency Code]` 
e.g `{{prefix}}exchange 28 DUT` Exchanges 28 Rubines into DueUtil Credits.
Just say {{prefix}}{{command}} to get a list of all available currencies.
usage.daily:
`{{prefix}}daily` to get your daily bonus, streak 10 days in a row for a higher bonus1
 `{{prefix}}daily epoch` to check how much time until next global refresh.
usage.selfroles:
`{{prefix}}selfroles [add | del | list] [Role| @role | Role ID] ["Shorthand"]` 

`{{prefix}}selfroles add Games` Allows the **Games** Role as self-assignable.
`{{prefix}}selfroles del Games` Removes the role **Games** from the list.
`{{prefix}}selfroles list` Shows the list and commands for each Self-Assignable Role

 These are Case insensitive, you can use Role ID too.
`{{prefix}}selfroles clear` Deletes **all** selfroles from the list.
usage.purge:
`{{prefix}}purge [@USER | images | links | bots | content ] <AMOUNT | CONTENT>`

`{{prefix}}purge 271394014358405121 50` purges messages from the user specified within the past 50 messages. If no user is specified, it defaults to yourself, if no amount is specified, it defaults to 100.

**__Other Examples:__**
`{{prefix}}purge bots 120` Deletes messages from Bots amongst the past 150 messages
`{{prefix}}purge links 150` Deletes messages containing Links amongst the past 150 messages
`{{prefix}}purge content pollux is bad` Deletes Messages containing *"pollux is bad"*~. 


**__Advanced:__** 
Reverse Filter: You can delete all the messages that **DOESN'T** match the criteria instead. just add `reverse_filter` after the command.
E.g. `{{prefix}}purge reverse_filter images 1000` Will delete all messages that **does not** contain images, and filter out the ones that have, all within the past 1000 messages.
usage.eggtrade:
**Making a Trade**
`{{prefix}}trade [Egg ID] @someone`
E.g.`{{prefix}}trade U2 @someone` Will trade the *Aquamarine Pulse Egg* with *@Someone*

**Accepting a Trade**
To accept an incoming trade, you have 30s to respond the offer with *accept* + one of your Eggs' ID, only two-way trades are allowed.
`accept SR1` Will send *Dark Magician Egg* in exchange for the *Aquamarine Pulse Egg* sent by the first user.

**You can only trade every 2 hours, so be careful. __Missed trades will use up your cooldown!__**
usage.lewd:
`{{prefix}}lewd`
You can also choose from which curator you will want to see the picks from! Just type their name after the command like `{{prefix}}lewd pollyanna` for example, to see only stuff curated by **Pollyanna**.

 Our current curator squad is:
 {{squad}}
usage.marry:
Marriage relies directly on `{{prefix}}craft`, since you need a ring before you can propose.

To marry your loved one, do `{{prefix}}marry @user [ring]`. There are 4 tiers of wedding rings, each one made of a different gemstone, to show off how fancy your marriage is. 

Example usage: `{{prefix}}marry @someone rubine` to propose with a Rubine ring.
$t(commands:meta.referCrafting)
usage.craft:
`{{prefix}}craft [item code]`
 You can find the item code and all information at http://pollux.fun/crafting.

To craft an item you need to own all required materials, some materials need to be crafted in order to be available, those are not autocrafted when doing a higher tier item.
usage.divorce:
`{{prefix}}divorce` To show everyone you are married to. whether that is one person or a whole harem!
`{{prefix}}divorce [@user || Discord ID]` To divorce that person

meta.notDocumented: *This command has not been documented yet.* :c
meta.referCrafting:
_____
*This command require items obtained from [Crafting]({{websiteRoot}}/crafting), please check `{{prefix}}craft help` as well to understand more about it~*
